conclusion: Liquid flows out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Stream A drops straight down without meeting any obstacle.
Stream B hits the pink baffle and is deflected to the left.
Stream C strikes the green slanted barrier and is deflected to the left.
Stream D flows along the white slanted barrier and turns right.

premise: Stream A drops straight down without meeting any obstacle.
conclusion: Stream A flows directly into container E.

premise: Stream B hits the pink baffle and is deflected to the left.
conclusion: Stream B flows towards container E.

premise: Stream C strikes the green slanted barrier and is deflected to the left.
conclusion: Stream C merges with Stream B and flows towards container F after encountering the blue baffle.

premise: Stream D flows along the white slanted barrier and turns right.
conclusion: Stream D flows directly into container F.

premise: Stream A flows directly into container E; Stream B flows towards container E; Stream C merges with Stream B and flows towards container F; Stream D flows directly into container F.
conclusion: Most liquid from A and little liquid from B end in container E; the other liquid from B, C, and D reach container F.
